T1.label: Digital Franchise Premium
T1.description: Digital Franchise Premium — Quality Justifies the Multiple
T1.plain_english: CBA's digital-first strategy, dominant market position, and operational efficiency justify a sustained premium to peers.
T1.what_to_watch: CommBank app MAU growth, cost-to-income ratio, home lending market share.
T1.upside: Material re-rating if digital franchise premium expands further.
T1.risk_plain: If premium multiples mean-revert, significant downside risk.

T2.label: NIM Compression
T2.description: NIM Compression — Rate Cuts Squeeze the Franchise
T2.plain_english: The RBA rate-cutting cycle compresses CBA's net interest margin, reducing earnings.
T2.what_to_watch: Quarterly NIM disclosures, RBA rate decisions, deposit mix trends.
T2.risk_plain: If NIM falls to 1.85-1.90%, EPS could decline 5-8% from peak levels.

T3.label: Competitive Disruption
T3.description: Competitive Disruption — Neo-Banks and Non-Bank Lenders
T3.plain_english: Digital-native competitors and non-bank lenders take share in specific segments.
T3.what_to_watch: Neo-bank/fintech mortgage share, CDR adoption, payments disintermediation.
T3.risk_plain: If competitive moat narrows, the valuation premium compresses.

T4.label: Credit Cycle Normalisation
T4.description: Credit Cycle Normalisation — Housing Risk Re-emerges
T4.plain_english: Credit losses normalise from cyclical lows as unemployment rises or house prices correct.
T4.what_to_watch: Unemployment rate, house prices, loan impairment expense, 90-day arrears.
T4.risk_plain: If credit costs normalise to 15-25bp, cash NPAT could fall by $1-2B annually.

big_picture: Commonwealth Bank of Australia (ASX: CBA) — coverage initiated. Full analysis pending.

NIM Compression — Rate Cuts Squeeze the Franchise
Competitive Disruption — Neo-Banks and Non-Bank Lenders
Credit Cycle Normalisation — Housing Risk Re-emerges
